subject: Politics
title: What Is Political Power
description: A micro-lesson that makes What Is Political Power usable.

hook.text: Power is the ability to make others do what you want. In politics, it decides who gets what, when, and how.

buildup.text: Political power takes many forms: coercion, persuasion, authority, and control over resources and information.

discovery.text: Weber named three types of authority: traditional, charismatic, and legal-rational. Each shapes power differently.

twist.text: The most effective power is invisible. You obey without realizing it because norms and culture do the enforcing.

climax.text: Understanding power means seeing beyond titles and offices. Real power often hides behind formal structures.

punchline.text: Power shapes everything. Those who wield it decide who wins and who loses.

quiz.question: What are Weber's three types of legitimate authority?
